subject: Travel
title: Overtourism in Venice
description: A micro-lesson that makes Overtourism in Venice usable.

hook.text: Venice gets 30 million visitors a year but only has 50,000 residents. The city is being loved to death.

buildup.text: Cruise ships once sailed right through the city center, causing waves that eroded ancient foundations.

discovery.text: Residents are leaving. Housing has become Airbnb rentals and shops sell only tourist souvenirs.

twist.text: In 2024, Venice became the first city to charge a tourist entry fee â€” five euros just to walk in.

climax.text: Critics say it's too little. Supporters say it's the start of treating cities as living places, not theme parks.

punchline.text: Venice now charges you just to enter.

quiz.question: What did Venice introduce in 2024 to combat overtourism?
